sentences.english: Blocking the quorum sensing system would be equivalent to using white noise to interfere with spoken communication, Blackwell adds.
sentences.chinese: 干擾羣體感應系統就相當於用白噪音去阻擾口頭通訊。

sentences.english: And the conclusion is that the change of impedance of electric load will make resonant frequency changing.
sentences.chinese: 電負載的阻擾改變將引起振子共振頻率的改變。

sentences.english: He has made some attempts, only to be stonewalled by the Republicans.
sentences.chinese: 他做出過一些嘗試，但是都受到了共和黨的阻擾。

sentences.english: So the Republican plan is to delay and disrupt reform.
sentences.chinese: 因此，共和黨的計劃是拖延並阻擾改革的進行。

sentences.english: We need to foul one of their guys in order to stop the clock.
sentences.chinese: 爲了延緩比賽我們需要犯規阻擾對方的一名隊員。

definition: to whisper to one another's ear
each sticks to his own version (idiom); a dialogue of the deaf
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
to appoint people by favoritism (idiom); nepotism/corrupt appointment
delaying tactics/stalling/measures to stave off an attack/stratagem to win a respite
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
to have no other choice/to be the last resort
pinyin: bu4 de2 yi3 er2 wei2 zhi1
